intro: Draba metaarctica, commonly known as the Arctic bellflower, is a small flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its compact growth habit and bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cold, harsh environments. It has a short growing season and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Draba metaarctica is an important component of polar and alpine ecosystems, contributing to biodiversity in extreme climates.
